Package civitas.celestis.math

Class Calculator

java.lang.Object
civitas.celestis.math.Calculator
public final class Calculator extends Object
A mathematically accurate calculator.

    • derivative

      @Nonnull public static UnaryOperator<Double> derivative(@Nonnull UnaryOperator<Double> f)
      Returns the derivative function of the provided function f. Note that this is an approximation of the derivative. This method uses Numbers.EPSILON as the scalar parameter.
      Parameters:
      f - The function to get the derivative of
      Returns:
      The derivative function

    • derivative

      @Nonnull public static UnaryOperator<Double> derivative(@Nonnull UnaryOperator<Double> f, double h)
      Returns the derivative function of the provided function f. Note that this is an approximation of the derivative.
      Parameters:
      f - The function to get the derivative of
      h - A small value of which to calculate the derivative by
      Returns:
      The derivative function

    • root

      public static double root(@Nonnull UnaryOperator<Double> f, double initialGuess)
      Given a function f, this returns the root of the function which is closest to the initial guess using the Newton's method to estimate its root.

      Note that this method has no limitations in the number of recursions, and in certain cases can end up in an infinite loop.

      Parameters:
      f - The function to solve
      initialGuess - The initial guess
      Returns:
      The root of the function f closest to the initial guess

    • root

      public static double root(@Nonnull UnaryOperator<Double> f, double initialGuess, int limit)
      Given a function f, this returns the root of the function which is closest to the initial guess using the Newton's method to estimate its root.
      Parameters:
      f - The function to solve
      initialGuess - The initial guess
      limit - The maximum number of iterations allowed
      Returns:
      The root of the function f closest to the initial guess
